body.p: Born in Lancaster, Ohio. Older brother of U.S. Senator of Ohio, John Sherman. William Sherman graduated from West Point in 1840. Fought the Seminoles in Florida. Administrative Officer in California during the Mexican-American War. Resigned U.S. Army in 1853. Moved to California to work in banking, career ruined by Panic of 1857. Older brother, Sen. John Sherman gets William a commission as Colonel in U.S. Army after Civil War broke out.

Fought in First Battle of Bull Run (July 21, 1861). After the battle, Sherman earned a commission as a Brigadier General. Gained command in Kentucky in October 1861. Removed from this command and sent to work under General Ulysses S. Grant as a divisional commander. Sherman performed well at the Battle of Shiloh (April 6-7, 1862) and was promoted to Major General. Helped Grant lead campaign to capture Vicksburg (1862-1863). Sherman received command of the Army of Tennessee. Fought in the Chattanooga campaign. Sherman took Atlanta on September 2, 1864. Lead 62,000 troops on his famous "March to the Sea" from Atlanta to Savannah, Georgia.
